summary: The Federal Reserve Transparency Act of 2025 mandates a full audit of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System and the Federal Reserve Banks by the Comptroller General of the United States.  The bill specifies a 12-month timeframe for the audit and requires a report to Congress within 90 days of completion.  It aims to remove limitations on the audit process, specifically referencing Title 31 and sections of the Federal Reserve Act in order to increase public access to information regarding the Federal Reserve.
